Dear Families,
We cannot begin to imagine the emotions we each feel in this moment (or those leading to this time), but what we can do is confirm our commitment to you and the ideals we strive for as a school community. As a school community, we are here for each other, and more than ever we need to reach out to our friends and neighbors and show the compassion, empathy, and humanity everyone deserves.

We want to be clear that hatred and racism have no home at our school. Bigotry, bullying, or discrimination will not be tolerated. We treasure and hold dear the relationships that create our unique community -- those between teacher, student, and parent, all to support students’ academic and personal growth.

For students who want and need additional support at this time, we encourage you to reach out to our counselors.

Sincerely,

Walter Wallace
School Leader
